details.content: In view of the general elections 2019, the interim Budget for the current fiscal was presented by Finance Minister Piyush Goyal in February this year.

Till the year 2016, the Union Budget was presented on the last working day of February. Former Finance Minister Arun Jaitley had changed the tradition in 2017 when the Union Budget was presented on February 1.

details.title: Finance Minister meets the President
details.content:
Rashtrapati Bhavan: As per tradition, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman calls on President Ramnath Kovind before presenting the Union Budget pic.twitter.com/5vOMn9qj2H

details.title: FM ditches briefcase for 'bahi khata'
details.content: The budget documents have been kept in four-fold red cloth instead of the usual briefcase. The FM said: "It is in Indian tradition. It symbolizes our departure from slavery of Western thought. It is not a budget but a 'bahi khata' (ledger)." (Photo | Parveen Negi, EPS)

details.title: General deficit at decade-low, will likely settle at 5.8 per cent of GDP in FY19: Economic Survey
details.content: According to the Economic Survey 2018-19, the combined deficit will likely settle at 5.8 per cent of GDP in FY19 as against 6.4 per cent in FY18. This is a decade-low and the third lowest on record since the 1990s. READ FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Budget 2019: Here are the biggest challenges facing Nirmala Sitharaman
details.content: The new finance minister inherits an economy facing a number of risks: Growth is slowing on the back of weak domestic consumption, while global demand is waning because of an escalating US-China trade war. She’ll also need to find the money to fund Modi’s populist campaign pledges without undermining the budget deficit target of 3.4 per cent of gross domestic product for the year through March 2020. details.content:

Union Cabinet approves Budget 2019. It will be presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman at the Lok Sabha shortly.
The Budget presentation begins. The FM quotes, Chanakya Neeti sutra says 'Kaarya purusha kare na lakshyam sampa dayate'. Meaning, with determined human efforts the task will surely be completed.

details.title: Spend on food security doubles in past five years: FM
details.content: Nirmala Sitharaman begins her budget presentation. Among first pronouncements, a commendation of Modi 1.0's work. Also underlined the fact that spend on food security has doubled in the past five years. Is that a sign of the note the budget is about to strike? We will have to wait and see.

details.title: Economy rose from $1.8 trillion to $2.7 trillion under NDA-I: Finance Minister
details.content: She also highlights the fact that India has grown from being a $1.8 trillion trillion to a $2.7 trillion economy under Modi 1.0. The target that the government has now set itself is to almost double this to make India a $5 trillion economy by 2024.
India is the third largest economy after the US and China already, says Nirmala Sitharaman

The people of India have validated their two goals for India's future - national security and economic growth, the Finance Ministry says in her speech, which also finds an early mention from Chanakya Niti.
FM stresses on the minimum government, maximun governance mantra of the Centre

We have implemented last-mile delivery. Citizens in every nook and corner of India has felt the difference. Our objective was and continues to be Mazbooth Desh Ke Liye Mazbooth Nagarik, underlines Sitharaman.

Sagar Mala is pro-common man, Jal Marg Vikas scheme has developed national waterways, Udaan scheme enables common citizens to avail cheap air travel. India is entering aviation finance industry, becoming all the more self-reliant: Nirmala Sitharaman
Total of 657 kms of Metro lines in operation across India: FM Sitharaman

details.title: FM makes push for environment-friendly transport for public
details.content: Upfront incentives for those who adopt electric vehicles: FM

details.title: FM makes push for environment-friendly transport for public
details.content: Upfront incentives for those who adopt electric vehicles, says the FInance Minister. She also announces that there will be comprehensive restructuring of the National Highway programme. States to be connected better by State highway networks in next phase.

details.title: $5-trillion economy by 2024 eminently achievable - Sitharaman
details.content: When we aspire to reach 5 trillion dollars, many wonder whether it is possible. The target is eminently achievable, given our citizens' desire and the leadership of the Government, the Finance Minister underlines.

details.title: One nation, one card to ensure mobility
details.content: FM proposes one common travel card for people to travel across the country on all modes of transport. She talks of how India's first indigenous payment ecosystem for transport based on National Common Mobility Card was launched by the PM in March 2019.

details.title: India INC are our wealth creators: Sitharaman
details.content:
FM: We don't look down upon legitimate profit earning. Gone are the days of policy paralysis & license quota control regime. India Inc are India's job creators, nation's wealth creators. Together with mutual trust we can gain, catalyse past & attain sustained growth. #Budget2019 pic.twitter.com/vJh1abVhZS

— ANI (@ANI) July 5, 2019

details.title: Modern tenant law to be formulated and circulated: FM
details.content: FM proposes reforms to improve rental housing and affordable housing. Current rental laws are archaic. They do not treat the relation between the lessor and lessee/tenant and owner in a fair manner. Government will look at improving the law.
India needs investments worth Rs 20 lakh crore per year: Nirmala Sitharaman

details.title: Plan to use rivers to transport cargo: Sitharaman
details.content: Government wants to use rivers for cargo transportation, which will also decongest roads and railways, says Finance Minister
Nifty 50 in red at 11938, Sensex too erases gains to trade at just 23 points up at 39931.

details.title: 100% FDI for insurance intermediaries
details.content:
100% Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) cleared for insurance intermediaries. Also an increase in FDI limits for sectors like aviation, media, animation and insurance to be considered.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman: Govt will invite suggestions for further opening up of FDI in aviation sector, media, animation AVGC and insurance sectors in consultation with all stakeholders. 100% FDI will be permitted for insurance intermediaries pic.twitter.com/xqhphPXRrI

— ANI (@ANI) July 5, 2019
Investment norms to be eased in single brand retail: FM
Payment platform for Medium and Small and Medium Enterprises to be created, says the Finance Minister.
It's the right time to consider increasing minimum public shareholding in the listed companies, I have asked SEBI to consider raising the current threshold of 25% to 35%: FM

details.title: Pensions to be extended to around 3 crore retail traders and shopkeepers
details.content: Pensions to be extended to around 3 crore retail traders and shopkeepers with an annual turnover of less than Rs 1.5 crore under the Pradhan Mantri Karam Yogi Man Dhan Scheme, says Finance Minister

details.title: Social stock exchange to list social enterprises and voluntary outfits
details.content: Electronic Fundraising Platform, a social stock exchange, to list social enterprises and voluntary outfits working for social welfare objections to raise funds via equity, debt or issue units like mutual funds announced

details.title: 1.95 crore houses for the poor by 2022 under PMAY-Gramin: FM
details.content: 1.95 crore houses are proposed to be provided with toilets, electricity and LPG connections to those eligible. From 315 days to 114 days, the completion period of the houses has come down from 2015-16.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman: To deepen corporate tri-party repo market in corporate debt securities, govt will work with regulators RBI & SEBI to enable stock exchanges to allow AA rated bonds as collaterals. #Budget2019 pic.twitter.com/T0alZuudA6

— ANI (@ANI) July 5, 2019

details.title: NRI investment is less, proposes to merge it with FPI route
details.content: To provide Non-resident Indians (NRIs) seamless access to Indian equities, NRI portfolio investment route to be merged with foreign portfolio investment route: FM
Local sourcing norms for Foreign Direct Investment to be eased for single-brand retailing sector, says Finance Minister

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman: Annual Global Investors' Meet to be organized in India, using National Investment and Infrastructure Fund(NIIF) as the anchor to get key sets of global players to come and invest in India #Budget2019 pic.twitter.com/jegvdQSlV9

— ANI (@ANI) July 5, 2019

details.title: Railway infra will need Rs 50-lakh investment in next 12 years
details.content:
Railway infra would need an investment of Rs 50 lakh crores between 2018 and 2030. 
Public-private partnership (PPP) to be used to unleash faster development and delivery of passenger freight services.
Ease of living and ease of doing business should both apply to farmers: FM
FM announces Rs 80,250 crore for road projects

details.title: New Space India Limited (NSIL) incorporated to tap the benefits of ISRO
details.content: To harness India's space ability commercially, a public-sector enterprise, New Space India Limited (NSIL) has been incorporated to tap the benefits of ISRO.

details.title: 'Water for all Indians a priority for us'
details.content: Har Ghar Jal: All rural homes will get water supply by 2020.
We will go back to basics on one account, Zero Budget Farming, says the Finance Minister.

details.title: Farmers income needs to be doubled: FM
details.content: We will go back to basics on one account, Zero Budget Farming, says the Finance Minister.

9.6 crore toilets constructed from 2014 in rural areas

FM Sitharaman: 9.6 crore toilets have been constructed since Oct 2, 2014. More than 5.6 lakh villages have become open defecation free.We have to build on this success. I propose to expand the Swachh Bharat mission to undertake sustainable sold waste management in every village pic.twitter.com/j8dFeTyRVS

— ANI (@ANI) July 5, 2019

details.title: Tap water in every house by 2024 our aim, says Finance Minister
details.content: Jal Shakti Ministry will work towards ensuring Har Ghar Jal Pani (Water in every house) by 2024 through a focus on integrated demand and supply, says the Finance Minister
Markets don't seem to be enthusiastic after all the direct measures on increasing public shareholding limits, FPI limits, both Nifty and Sensex slip into red. Sensex down 115 points, Nifty 43

details.title: NRIs to be given seamless access to Indian equities
details.content: To give NRIs seamless access to Indian equities, the NRI portfolio investment route will be merged with foreign portfolio investment route, says the Finance Minister. Existing KYC norms for Foreign Portfolio Investors to be rationalized and simplified, to make it more investor-friendly.

details.title: Gaon, Garib and Kisan our focus, says the Finance Minister
details.content: Our government has "Gaon, Garib and Kisan" at the centre of every plan we make, in every programme of ours, says Sitharaman
National Research Foundation to be set up to fund, to coordinate and to promote research in the country: FM

details.title: Target 75000 skilled entrepreneurs in agro-rural industries
details.content: To achieve this aim, 80 livelihood business incubators and 20 technology business incubators will be set up in 2019-20 under ASPIRE to develop the 75000 skilled entrepreneurs in agro-rural industries

details.title: Study in India programme to make foreign students study here
details.content: With the aim of making India a hub of higher education, the Finance Minister says she proposes a 'Study in India' programme to bring in foreign students to pursue education in the country. Also announced, a Rs 400-crore allocation for institutions of higher education. This is more than three times the revised estimate of the previous year!
"Study in India will focus on bringing foreign students to India for higher education," proposes Nirmala Sitharaman.

details.title: FM proposes to streamline multiple labour laws under 4 codes
details.content: The Code on Wages Bill will combine four labour laws — Payment of Wages Act, 1936, Minimum Wages Act, 1948, Payment of Bonus Act, 1965, and Equal Remuneration Act, 1976.

details.title: Faster internet in every panchayat soon
details.content: Under the Pradhan Mantri Grameen Digital Saksharata Abhiyan, #BharatNet will target providing net connectivity for every panchayat in the country. This will be speeded up under the Universal Service Obligation Fund, the Finance Minister announces
Expand Swachh Bharat mission to undertake solid waste management in villages: FM

details.title: 'Nari to Narayani': Our mantra
details.content: FM quotes Swami Vivekananda, stresses on greater participation of women in economy. Uses the 'Nari to Narayani' mantra to applause from the House.
Plan to issue Aadhaar for NRIs holding Indian passport right on their arrival in India. This will be without the 180-days waiting period, says the Finance Minister

details.title: Simpler labour codes soon
details.content: The multiple labour laws - around 100 of them - will be streamlined into a set of four Labour Codes to standardise registration and filing of returns and to reduce disputes, says the Finance Minister. The Code on Wages Bill will combine four labour laws — Payment of Wages Act, 1936, Minimum Wages Act, 1948, Payment of Bonus Act, 1965, and Equal Remuneration Act, 1976.

details.title: FM on Non-Performing Assets
details.content: Recovery of over Rs 4 lakh crores made, says the FM. NPAs cleared by over Rs 1 lakh crore.

details.title: Additional Rs 75000-crore firepower for public sector banks
details.content: Rs 75000 crore in additional capital to be provided to public-sector banks to boost credit and to give impetus to the economy, says the Finance Minister. Adds to the burden... One-time six month partial credit guarantee to buy pooled assets of sound NBFCs. The government proposes Rs 100 lakh crore investment for infrastructure over 5 years, the FM announces.

details.title: 'Startup India' will be continued for the entire period between 2020 to 2025
details.content: Exclusive TV programme exclusively for startups to be started on DD National, channel will be designed and executed by startups themselves: FM

details.title: FM announces schemes to improve women entrepreneurship
details.content: For every verified woman Self Help Group (SHG) member having a Jan Dhan account, an overdraft of 5000 rupees will be allowed, announces the FM. One woman in every SHG shall be made eligible for a loan of Rs 1 lakh under the MUDRA scheme.
India plans to open four new embassies in 2019-20 to provide better public services to local Indian communities, the finance minister announces.

details.title: Strategic disinvestment of Air India proposed
details.content: Government disinvestment limit at Rs 1.05 lakh crore, proposes strategic disinvestment of many Central Public Sector Enterprises, and also Air India. Says government will try to meet 25% public shareholding norms in all listed Central Public Sector Enterprises.

details.title: FM on tourism
details.content: "The government is developing 17 iconic tourism sites as world-class tourist centres to improve tourism. Documentaries with anthropological details will be stored for tourists," says Nirmala Sitharaman.
No income tax for incomes less than Rs 5 lakh per year, the FM announces.

details.title: Future is electric! Additional Rs 1.5 lakh deduction for those buying these green vehicles
details.content: Additional Rs 1.5 lakh a year tax deduction for those repaying loans availed to buy electric vehicles

details.title: Tax redemption to boost purchase of electric vehicles
details.content: Additional IT deduction on interest on loans for electric vehicles, the FM announces

details.title: Taxpayers can file returns by simply quoting Aadhaar
details.content: Aadhaar is all that is needed. It can be used instead of PAN card from now on, announces the Finance Minister.

details.title: TDS of 2% on withdrawal of Rs 1 crore per year: Finance Minister
details.content: To discourage use of cash in business transactions the Finance Minister proposes 2% TDS on cash withdrawal exceeding Rs 1 crore in a year from a bank account.

details.title: Government slashes corporate tax rates
details.content: Until now, a lower corporate tax rate of 25 per cent was applicable to companies having an annual turnover of upto Rs 250 crores. Now, companies having annual turnover of Rs 400 crores will be under the 25% bracket. This will cover 99.3% of all the companies, said the FM.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman quotes a verse in Tamil to explain that the government does not intend to 'trample' taxpayers with the weight of taxation. The tax collection has increased to 11.37 lakh crore in 2018-19 from 6.37 lakh crore in 2013-14, she points out.

Finance Minister #NirmalaSitharaman quotes Purananooru, a Tamil Sangam era work, says: "If an elephant tramples the field it eats rice from, it will eat less than what it destroys."#Budget2019 #BudgetForNewIndia

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) July 5, 2019

details.title: Digital payment push
details.content: Businesses with over Rs 50-crore turnover should offer digital payments at no cost to consumer and merchants

details.title: Tax surcharge for the super-rich
details.content: Additional surcharge on taxable income from Rs 2 crore to Rs 5 crore - will mean 3 to 7% increase in tax for them
The FM also announced faceless tax assessment in electronic mode, calling it a paradigm shift in the functioning of the Income Tax dept functioning.

details.title: Gold to be dearer
details.content: Gold bugs will have to shell out more. Or dare we say gold jewellery bugs. Customs duty on gold has been increased from 10% to 12.5%. The yellow metal will be dearer.

#Budget2019

- Customs on gold to increase from 10% to 12.5%
- Re.1 cess on petrol and diesel
- Fully automated #GST refund model
- Basic customs on select goods hiked.#BudgetForNewIndia

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) July 5, 2019
The Budget 2019 presentation has concluded.
Tax proposals, especially in HNIs likely to have impacted market sentiment. Sensex down by over 300 points and Nifty 100
